Question: For Lord Byron, this person was the epitome of the Romantic hero, the persecuted, lonely and flawed genius.
Hints: This person approached the regiment alone, dismounted his horse and, when he was within gunshot range, shouted, "Here I am.
This person participated actively in the sessions of the Council of State that revised the drafts.
Muhammad Ali of Egypt sought alliance with this person's France and sought to modernize Egypt along French governmental lines.
